title: List of constructs
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Constructs** are monsters which, although technically [nonliving](/Nonliving "Nonliving"), are animated through magical means. Like all nonliving monsters, they are immune to [poison](/Poison "Poison"), [asphyxiation](/Asphyxiation "Asphyxiation"), and [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy"). Golems tend to have many elemental resistances, though many are vulnerable to [Lee's Rapid Deconstruction](/Lee%27s_Rapid_Deconstruction "Lee's Rapid Deconstruction") and [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter").

Although similar in some ways to [statues](/Statue "Statue"), constructs are set apart by their ability to move.

## Contents

- [1 Golems](#Golems)
  - [1.1 Variant Golems](#Variant_Golems)
- [2 Gargoyles](#Gargoyles)
- [3 Other Constructs](#Other_Constructs)
- [4 Retired Constructs](#Retired_Constructs)
- [5 History](#History)

## Golems

**Golems** are big, hulking, mindless constructs that are generally rather slow but pack quite a punch. Some of the more powerful ones have high AC, and they all come with complete immunity to anything subject to [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") and varying levels of resistance to elemental magic.

- 9 [![Blazeheart golem.png](/images/d/db/Blazeheart_golem.png)](/File:Blazeheart_golem.png) **[Blazeheart golem](/Blazeheart_golem "Blazeheart golem")**- A construct [summoned](/Summon_Blazeheart_Golem "Summon Blazeheart Golem") into existence. It damages itself each time it attacks, and once killed, it will soon [explode](/Blazeheart_core "Blazeheart core"). If not adjacent to the player, it will power down and do nothing.
- 9 [![Ushabti.png](/images/0/00/Ushabti.png)](/File:Ushabti.png) **[Ushabti](/Ushabti "Ushabti")**- Servants built to assist [mummies](/List_of_mummies "List of mummies") in their afterlives. They guard their masters' [Tomb](/Tomb "Tomb") by spewing clouds of [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma").
- 9 [![Saltling.png](/images/f/fc/Saltling.png)](/File:Saltling.png) **[Saltling](/Saltling "Saltling")**- Small, zippy golems made from the only material available in the [Desolation of Salt](/Desolation_of_Salt "Desolation of Salt"). They're fragile, but there's a lot of them...
- 9 [![Peacekeeper.png](/images/6/64/Peacekeeper.png)](/File:Peacekeeper.png) **[Peacekeeper](/Peacekeeper "Peacekeeper")**- Swift, [manticore](/Manticore "Manticore")-like enforcers that roam the Desolation of Salt and support their allies in hunting down intruders.
- 9 [![Toenail golem.png](/images/c/cd/Toenail_golem.png)](/File:Toenail_golem.png) **[Toenail golem](/Toenail_golem "Toenail golem")**- Bizarre creations that are rarely seen, even for golems. They're fairly easy to take down.
- 8 [![Spellforged servitor (monster).png](/images/a/ab/Spellforged_servitor_%28monster%29.png)](/File:Spellforged_servitor_\(monster\).png) **[Spellforged servitor](/Spellforged_servitor_\(monster\) "Spellforged servitor (monster)")** - Experienced mages may [summon](/Spellforged_Servitor "Spellforged Servitor") a construct that can cast their most [destructive spell](/Conjurations "Conjurations").
- 9 [![Iron golem.png](/images/e/ed/Iron_golem.png)](/File:Iron_golem.png) **[Iron golem](/Iron_golem "Iron golem")**- Made of solid iron, these golems are slow, but very strong and extremely durable.
- 9 [![Crystal guardian.png](/images/6/60/Crystal_guardian.png)](/File:Crystal_guardian.png) **[Crystal guardian](/Crystal_guardian "Crystal guardian")**- Crystalline sentinels who pelt intruders with ricocheting bolts of [fire](/Fire "Fire") and [cold](/Cold "Cold").
- 9 [![Electric golem.png](/images/f/f9/Electric_golem.png)](/File:Electric_golem.png) **[Electric golem](/Electric_golem "Electric golem")**- The most powerful golem, these roam the [Realm of Zot](/Realm_of_Zot "Realm of Zot") and annihilate the unprepared with [bolts of lightning](/Lightning_Bolt "Lightning Bolt") and electrical attacks. They are also much faster than other golems, immune to Lee's Rapid Deconstruction, and [blink](/Blink "Blink") constantly.

### Variant Golems

8 [![Flesh golem.png](/images/9/98/Flesh_golem.png)](/File:Flesh_golem.png) **[Flesh golem](/Cigotuvi%27s_Fleshworks#Miniboss:_Flesh_Golem "Cigotuvi's Fleshworks")** - An earlier work of the master flesh-mage Cigotuvi that diligently guards his [laboratory](/Cigotuvi%27s_Fleshworks "Cigotuvi's Fleshworks"). Though made of flesh, it is as powerful as an [iron golem](/Iron_golem "Iron golem").

## Gargoyles

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | “Their innumerable sculptures of demons and dragons assumed a lugubrious aspect. The restless light of the flame made them move to the eye. There were griffins which had the air of laughing, gargoyles which one fancied one heard yelping, salamanders which puffed at the fire, tarasques which sneezed in the smoke. And among the monsters thus roused from their sleep of stone by this flame, by this noise, there was one who walked about, and who was seen, from time to time, to pass across the glowing face of the pile, like a bat in front of a candle.” -Victor Hugo, \_The Hunchback of Notre-Dame\_, 10, ch. IV. 1831. trans. Isabel F. Hapgood |

**Gargoyles** are similar to golems in construction, but possess an actual intelligence. This allows them to wield weapons and behave less mechanically, but also renders them susceptible to [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes"). Not only are they capable with [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails"), but they can also hurl portions of themselves at opponents.

- 9 [![Gargoyle.png](/images/4/44/Gargoyle.png)](/File:Gargoyle.png) **[Gargoyle](/Gargoyle_\(monster\) "Gargoyle (monster)")** - Predatory statuary that swoop through [the Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon") in search of victims to pelt with [Stone Arrows](/Stone_Arrow "Stone Arrow").
- 9 [![Molten gargoyle.png](/images/f/f9/Molten_gargoyle.png)](/File:Molten_gargoyle.png) **[Molten gargoyle](/Molten_gargoyle "Molten gargoyle")**- A hateful grotesque composed entirely of molten stone, giving its attacks a [fiery](/Fire "Fire") nature.
- 9 [![War gargoyle.png](/images/a/ae/War_gargoyle.png)](/File:War_gargoyle.png) **[War gargoyle](/War_gargoyle "War gargoyle")**- Swift-flying metal warriors which swarm their foes and rain down [deadly shrapnel](/Metal_Splinters "Metal Splinters").

## Other Constructs

- \* [![Battlesphere.png](/images/6/67/Battlesphere.png)](/File:Battlesphere.png) **[Battlesphere](/Battlesphere "Battlesphere")**- [Conjured](/Iskenderun%27s_Battlesphere "Iskenderun's Battlesphere") attack drones that fire unblockable barrages of energy to supplement their creator's [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations").
- ( [![Dancing weapon.png](/images/1/17/Dancing_weapon.png)](/File:Dancing_weapon.png) **[Dancing weapon](/Dancing_weapon "Dancing weapon")**- Weapons [enchanted](/Tukima%27s_Dance "Tukima's Dance") to attack under their own power. Larger ones hit harder, but move more slowly.

## Retired Constructs

- 8 [![Wood golem.png](/images/1/15/Wood_golem.png)](/File:Wood_golem.png) **[Wood golem](/Wood_golem "Wood golem")**- The weakest variety of golem. Unlike its stronger brethren, it burned easily.
- 8 [![Clay golem.png](/images/d/de/Clay_golem.png)](/File:Clay_golem.png) **[Clay golem](/Clay_golem "Clay golem")**- A basic golem. Big, but slow and easy to smash.
- 8 [![Stone golem.png](/images/2/2e/Stone_golem.png)](/File:Stone_golem.png) **[Stone golem](/Stone_golem "Stone golem")**- A significant step up from the clay golem in power and durability.
- 8 [![Crystal golem.png](/images/c/c9/Crystal_golem.png)](/File:Crystal_golem.png) **[Crystal golem](/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem")**- A durable golem made of solid crystal. Variants that can fire bolts of [cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold") and [fire](/Bolt_of_Fire "Bolt of Fire") appeared in certain vaults.
- 9 [![Metal gargoyle.png](/images/4/41/Metal_gargoyle.png)](/File:Metal_gargoyle.png) **[Metal gargoyle](/Metal_gargoyle "Metal gargoyle")**- A slower, sturdier gargoyle, most often found roosting in the [hellish](/Hell "Hell") [fortress](/The_Iron_City_of_Dis "The Iron City of Dis") of [Dispater](/Dispater "Dispater").
- 9 [![Guardian golem.png](/images/a/a4/Guardian_golem.png)](/File:Guardian_golem.png) **[Guardian golem](/Guardian_golem "Guardian golem")**- A [summoned](/Summon_Guardian_Golem "Summon Guardian Golem") golem that protects its allies, and explodes when killed.

## History

- In [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), guardian golems were replaced by blazeheart golems.
- The Desolation of Salt and its resident golems were added in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").
- Ushabtiu were added in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").
- [0.14](/0.14 "0.14") removed clay and stone golems and added guardian golems and spellforged servitors. Crystal golems were replaced with crystal guardians, and metal gargoyles were replaced with war gargoyles.
- Wood golems were removed in [0.12](/0.12 "0.12").

List of constructs

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Constructs are monsters which, although technically nonliving, are animated through magical means. Like all nonliving monsters, they are immune to poison, asphyxiation, and negative energy. Golems tend to have many elemental resistances, though many are vulnerable to Lee's Rapid Deconstruction and Shatter.

Although similar in some ways to statues, constructs are set apart by their ability to move.

Contents

  • 1 Golems
    • 1.1 Variant Golems
  • 2 Gargoyles
  • 3 Other Constructs
  • 4 Retired Constructs
  • 5 History

Golems

Golems are big, hulking, mindless constructs that are generally rather slow but pack quite a punch. Some of the more powerful ones have high AC, and they all come with complete immunity to anything subject to willpower and varying levels of resistance to elemental magic.

  • 9 Blazeheart golem- A construct summoned into existence. It damages itself each time it attacks, and once killed, it will soon explode. If not adjacent to the player, it will power down and do nothing.
  • 9 Ushabti- Servants built to assist mummies in their afterlives. They guard their masters' Tomb by spewing clouds of miasma.
  • 9 Saltling- Small, zippy golems made from the only material available in the Desolation of Salt. They're fragile, but there's a lot of them...
  • 9 Peacekeeper- Swift, manticore-like enforcers that roam the Desolation of Salt and support their allies in hunting down intruders.
  • 9 Toenail golem- Bizarre creations that are rarely seen, even for golems. They're fairly easy to take down.
  • 8 Spellforged servitor - Experienced mages may summon a construct that can cast their most destructive spell.
  • 9 Iron golem- Made of solid iron, these golems are slow, but very strong and extremely durable.
  • 9 Crystal guardian- Crystalline sentinels who pelt intruders with ricocheting bolts of fire and cold.
  • 9 Electric golem- The most powerful golem, these roam the Realm of Zot and annihilate the unprepared with bolts of lightning and electrical attacks. They are also much faster than other golems, immune to Lee's Rapid Deconstruction, and blink constantly.

Variant Golems

8 Flesh golem - An earlier work of the master flesh-mage Cigotuvi that diligently guards his laboratory. Though made of flesh, it is as powerful as an iron golem.

Gargoyles

“Their innumerable sculptures of demons and dragons assumed a lugubrious aspect. The restless light of the flame made them move to the eye. There were griffins which had the air of laughing, gargoyles which one fancied one heard yelping, salamanders which puffed at the fire, tarasques which sneezed in the smoke. And among the monsters thus roused from their sleep of stone by this flame, by this noise, there was one who walked about, and who was seen, from time to time, to pass across the glowing face of the pile, like a bat in front of a candle.”

-Victor Hugo, _The Hunchback of Notre-Dame_, 10, ch. IV. 1831.
trans. Isabel F. Hapgood

Gargoyles are similar to golems in construction, but possess an actual intelligence. This allows them to wield weapons and behave less mechanically, but also renders them susceptible to Hexes. Not only are they capable with Maces & Flails, but they can also hurl portions of themselves at opponents.

  • 9 Gargoyle - Predatory statuary that swoop through the Dungeon in search of victims to pelt with Stone Arrows.
  • 9 Molten gargoyle- A hateful grotesque composed entirely of molten stone, giving its attacks a fiery nature.
  • 9 War gargoyle- Swift-flying metal warriors which swarm their foes and rain down deadly shrapnel.

Other Constructs

  • * Battlesphere- Conjured attack drones that fire unblockable barrages of energy to supplement their creator's Conjurations.
  • ( Dancing weapon- Weapons enchanted to attack under their own power. Larger ones hit harder, but move more slowly.

Retired Constructs

  • 8 Wood golem- The weakest variety of golem. Unlike its stronger brethren, it burned easily.
  • 8 Clay golem- A basic golem. Big, but slow and easy to smash.
  • 8 Stone golem- A significant step up from the clay golem in power and durability.
  • 8 Crystal golem- A durable golem made of solid crystal. Variants that can fire bolts of cold and fire appeared in certain vaults.
  • 9 Metal gargoyle- A slower, sturdier gargoyle, most often found roosting in the hellish fortress of Dispater.
  • 9 Guardian golem- A summoned golem that protects its allies, and explodes when killed.

History

  • In 0.31, guardian golems were replaced by blazeheart golems.
  • The Desolation of Salt and its resident golems were added in 0.19.
  • Ushabtiu were added in 0.16.
  • 0.14 removed clay and stone golems and added guardian golems and spellforged servitors. Crystal golems were replaced with crystal guardians, and metal gargoyles were replaced with war gargoyles.
  • Wood golems were removed in 0.12.
